section.section:
The Administration may adopt rules and regulations providing for:
The licensing of commercial use airports and public use airports; and
The annual renewal of airport licenses.

For an airport license, the Administration may charge a license fee of not more than:
$25 for each original license; and
$10 for each renewal.

text.section: If the Administration provides for the licensing of these airports, a person may not operate a commercial use airport or a public use airport unless the person has an airport license as required by the rules and regulations of the Administration.

section.section: The Administration may issue an airport license or renewal subject to any reasonable condition that it considers necessary to fulfill any purpose of this subtitle.

Before renewal of an airport license and at any other reasonable time, the Administration may require that the airport operator provide the Administration with a list, by serial number and description, of all aircraft, based at the airport for which renewal is sought and the names and addresses of their owners.

The Administration may suspend an airport license pending a hearing if it reasonably determines that:
A condition exists that endangers the lives or property of persons using the airport or that endangers the occupants of the land near the airport; and
It is in the interest of public safety and the general welfare to stop use of the airport.
